010package imagingbook.pub.regions;
011
012import static imagingbook.pub.regions.NeighborhoodType.N4;
013
014import java.awt.Rectangle;
015import java.util.Arrays;
016import java.util.Formatter;
017import java.util.HashMap;
018import java.util.Iterator;
019import java.util.LinkedHashMap;
020import java.util.LinkedList;
021import java.util.List;
022import java.util.Locale;
023import java.util.Map;
024import java.util.NoSuchElementException;
025
026import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
027import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
028import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
029import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntDouble;
030import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntInt;
031
032/**
033 * Performs region segmentation on a given binary image.
034 * This class is abstract, since the implementation depends
035 * on the concrete region segmentation algorithm being used.
036 * Concrete implementations (subclasses of this class) are 
037 * {@link SegmentationBreadthFirst},
038 * {@link SegmentationDepthFirst},
039 * {@link SegmentationRecursive},
040 * {@link SegmentationSequential},
041 * {@link SegmentationRegionContour}.
042 * 
043 * Practically all work is done by the constructor(s).
044 * If the segmentation has failed for some reason
045 * {@link #getRegions()} returns {@code null}.
046 * 
047 * @version 2020/12/22
048 */
049public abstract class BinaryRegionSegmentation {
050        
051        public static final NeighborhoodType DEFAULT_NEIGHBORHOOD = N4;
052        
053        public static final int BACKGROUND = 0;
054        public static final int FOREGROUND = 1;
055        
056        protected ImageProcessor ip = null;
057        protected final int width;
058        protected final int height;     
059        protected final NeighborhoodType neighborType;
060        
061        protected final int[][] labelArray;
062        // label values in labelArray can be:
063        //  0 ... unlabeled
064        // -1 ... previously visited background pixel
065        // >0 ... valid label
066        
067        private final Map<Integer, BinaryRegion> regions;
068        private final boolean isSegmented;
069        
070        private final int minLabel = 2;
071        private int currentLabel = -1;  // the maximum label assigned sofar
072        private int maxLabel = -1;              // the maximum label assigned total
073        
074        // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
075        
076        protected BinaryRegionSegmentation(ByteProcessor ip, NeighborhoodType nh) {
077                this.ip = ip;
078                this.neighborType = nh;
079                this.width  = ip.getWidth();
080                this.height = ip.getHeight();
081                this.labelArray = makeLabelArray();
082                this.isSegmented = applySegmentation();
083                this.regions = (isSegmented) ? collectRegions() : null;
084                this.ip = null; // release image
085        }
086        
087        protected int[][] makeLabelArray() {
088                int[][] lA = new int[width][height];    // label array
089                // set all pixels to either FOREGROUND or BACKGROUND (by thresholding)
090                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
091                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
092                                lA[u][v] = (ip.getPixel(u, v) > 0) ? FOREGROUND : BACKGROUND;
093                        }
094                }
095                return lA;
096        }
097        
098        // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
099        
100        /**
101         * This method must be implemented by any concrete sub-class.
102         * @return true if successful.
103         */
104        protected abstract boolean applySegmentation();
105        
106        public int getWidth() {
107                return this.width;
108        }
109        
110        public int getHeight() {
111                return this.height;
112        }
113        
114        public int getMinLabel() {
115                return minLabel;
116        }
117        
118        public int getMaxLabel() {
119                return maxLabel;
120        }
121        
122        /**
123         * Returns an unsorted list of all regions associated with this region labeling.
124         * The returned list is empty if no regions were detected.
125         * See also {@link #getRegions(boolean)}.
126         * @return the list of detected regions or {@code null} if the segmentation has failed.
127         */
128        public List<BinaryRegion> getRegions() {
129                return getRegions(false);       // unsorted
130        }
131        
132        /**
133         * Returns a (optionally sorted) list of all regions associated with this region labeling.
134         * The returned list is empty if no regions were detected.
135         * @param sort set {@code true} to sort regions by size (largest regions first).
136         * @return the list of detected regions or {@code null} if the segmentation has failed.
137         */
138        public List<BinaryRegion> getRegions(boolean sort) {
139                if (regions == null) {
140                        return null;
141                }
142                else {
143                        BinaryRegion[] ra = regions.values().toArray(new BinaryRegion[0]);
144                        if (sort) {
145                                Arrays.sort(ra);
146                        }
147                        return Arrays.asList(ra);
148                }
149        }
150        
151        // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
152        
153        /**
154         * Creates a (map) container of {@link BinaryRegion} objects,
155         * collects the region pixels from the label image
156         * and calls {@link BinaryRegion#update()} to computes 
157         * the statistics for each region.
158         * Region label numbers serve as map keys.
159         * @return a map of {@link BinaryRegion} instances.
160         */
161        protected Map<Integer, BinaryRegion> collectRegions() {
162                BinaryRegion[] regionArray = new BinaryRegion[maxLabel + 1];
163                for (int label = minLabel; label <= maxLabel; label++) {
164                        regionArray[label] = new BinaryRegion(label);
165                }
166                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
167                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
168                                int label = getLabel(u, v);
169                                if (label >= minLabel && label <= maxLabel && regionArray[label] != null) {
170                                        regionArray[label].addPixel(u, v);
171                                }
172                        }
173                }
174                // create a list of regions to return, collect nonempty regions
175                Map<Integer, BinaryRegion> regionMap = new LinkedHashMap<>();
176                for (BinaryRegion r: regionArray) {
177                        if (r != null && r.getSize() > 0) {
178                                r.update();     // compute the statistics for this region
179                                regionMap.put(r.label, r); //add(r);
180                        }
181                }
182                return regionMap;
183        }
184        
185        /**
186         * Get the label number for the specified image coordinate.
187         * @param u the horizontal coordinate.
188         * @param v the vertical coordinate.
189         * @return the label number for the given position.
190         */
191        public int getLabel(int u, int v) {
192                return (u >= 0 && u < width && v >= 0 && v < height) ? labelArray[u][v] : -1;
193        }
194        
195        protected void setLabel(int u, int v, int label) {
196                if (u >= 0 && u < width && v >= 0 && v < height)
197                        labelArray[u][v] = label;
198        }
199        
200        protected int getNextLabel() {
201                currentLabel = (currentLabel < 1) ? minLabel : currentLabel + 1;
202                maxLabel = currentLabel;
203                return currentLabel;
204        }
205        
206        protected boolean isLabel(int i) {
207                return (i >= minLabel);
208        }
209
210        // --------------------------------------------------
211
212        /**
213         * Finds the region associated to the given label.
214         * @param label the region's label number.
215         * @return the region object associated with the given label
216         *              or {@code null} if it does not exist.
217         */
218        public BinaryRegion getRegion(int label) {
219                return (label < minLabel || label > maxLabel) ? null : regions.get(label);
220        }
221        
222        /**
223         * Finds the {@link BinaryRegion} instance associated with
224         * the given image position.
225         * @param u the horizontal position.
226         * @param v the vertical position.
227         * @return The associated {@link BinaryRegion} object or null if
228         *              this {@link BinaryRegionSegmentation} has no region at the given position.
229         */
230        public BinaryRegion getRegion(int u, int v) {
231                return getRegion(getLabel(u, v));
232        }
233                
234        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------
235        
236        /**
237         * This class represents a connected component or binary region. 
238         * It is implemented as an inner class to {@link BinaryRegionSegmentation} because
239         * it references common region labeling data.
240         * A {@link BinaryRegion} instance does not have its own list or array of 
241         * contained pixel coordinates but refers to the label array of the
242         * enclosing {@link BinaryRegionSegmentation} instance.
243         * Instances of this class support iteration over the contained pixel
244         * coordinates of type {@link Pnt2d}, e.g., by
245         * <pre>
246         * import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Point;
247         * 
248         * BinaryRegion R = ...;
249         * for (Point p : R) {
250         *    // process point p ...
251         * }</pre>
252         * The advantage of providing iteration only is that it avoids the
253         * creation of (possibly large) arrays of pixel coordinates.
254         */
255        public class BinaryRegion implements Comparable<BinaryRegion>, Iterable<Pnt2d> {
256                
257                private final int label;                                // the label of THIS region
258                private int size = 0;
259                private double xc = Double.NaN;
260                private double yc = Double.NaN;
261                private int left = Integer.MAX_VALUE;
262                private int right = -1;
263                private int top = Integer.MAX_VALUE;
264                private int bottom = -1;
265                
266                private Contour.Outer outerContour = null;
267                private List<Contour.Inner> innerContours = null;
268                
269                // summation variables used for various statistics
270                private long x1Sum = 0;
271                private long y1Sum = 0;
272                private long x2Sum = 0;
273                private long y2Sum = 0;
274                private long xySum = 0;
275                
276                // ------- constructor --------------------------
277                
278                private BinaryRegion(int label) {
279                        this.label = label;
280                }
281                
282                // ------- public methods --------------------------
283                
284                /**
285                 * Obsolete - use {@link #getCenter()} instead!
286                 * Get the x-value of the region's centroid.
287                 * Obsolete, use {@link #getCenter()} instead.
288                 * 
289                 * @return the x-value of the region's centroid.
290                 * @deprecated
291                 */
292                public double getXc() {
293                        return xc;
294                }
295
296                /**
297                 * Obsolete - use {@link #getCenter()} instead!
298                 * Get the y-value of the region's centroid.
299                 * Obsolete, use {@link #getCenter()} instead.
300                 * 
301                 * @return the y-value of the region's centroid.
302                 * @deprecated
303                 */
304                public double getYc() {
305                        return yc;
306                }
307                
308                /**
309                 * Returns the sum of the x-coordinates of the points
310                 * contained in this region.
311                 * 
312                 * @return the sum of x-values.
313                 */
314                public long getX1Sum() {
315                        return x1Sum;
316                }
317
318                /**
319                 * Returns the sum of the y-coordinates of the points
320                 * contained in this region.
321                 * 
322                 * @return the sum of y-values.
323                 */
324                public long getY1Sum() {
325                        return y1Sum;
326                }
327
328                /**
329                 * Returns the sum of the squared x-coordinates of the points
330                 * contained in this region.
331                 * 
332                 * @return the sum of squared x-values.
333                 */
334                public long getX2Sum() {
335                        return x2Sum;
336                }
337
338                /**
339                 * Returns the sum of the squared y-coordinates of the points
340                 * contained in this region.
341                 * 
342                 * @return the sum of squared y-values.
343                 */
344                public long getY2Sum() {
345                        return y2Sum;
346                }
347                
348                /**
349                 * Returns the sum of the mixed x*y-coordinates of the points
350                 * contained in this region.
351                 * 
352                 * @return the sum of xy-values.
353                 */
354                public long getXYSum() {
355                        return xySum;
356                }
357                
358                /**
359                 * Calculates and returns a vector of (unnormalized) central moments:
360                 * (mu10, mu01, mu20, mu02, mu11).
361                 * 
362                 * @return vector of central moments
363                 */
364                public double[] getCentralMoments() {
365                        if (size == 0) {
366                                throw new IllegalStateException("empty region, moments are undefined");
367                        }
368                        double n = size;
369//                      double mu10 = ; // always zero
370//                      double mu01 = ; // always zero
371                        double mu20 = x2Sum - x1Sum * x1Sum / n;
372                        double mu02 = y2Sum - y1Sum * y1Sum / n;
373                        double mu11 = xySum - x1Sum * y1Sum / n;
374                        return new double[] {mu20, mu02, mu11};
375                }
376                
377                /**
378                 * Returns the 2x2 covariance matrix for the pixel coordinates
379                 * contained in this region:
380                 * <pre>
381                 * | &sigma;_20 &sigma;_11 | 
382                 * | &sigma;_11 &sigma;_02 | 
383                 * </pre>
384                 * @return the covariance matrix
385                 */
386                public double[][] getCovarianceMatrix() {
387                        double[] mu = getCentralMoments(); // = (mu20, mu02, mu11)
388                        double[][] S = {
389                                        {mu[0]/size, mu[2]/size},
390                                        {mu[2]/size, mu[1]/size}};
391                        return S;
392                }
393                
394                /**
395                 * Get the label associated with this region.
396                 * @return the region label.
397                 */
398                public int getLabel() {
399                        return this.label;
400                }
401                
402                /**
403                 * Get the size of this region.
404                 * @return the number of region points.
405                 */
406                public int getSize() {
407                        return this.size;
408                }
409                
410                /**
411                 * Get the x/y axes-parallel bounding box as a rectangle
412                 * (including the extremal coordinates).
413                 * @return the bounding box rectangle.
414                 */
415                public Rectangle getBoundingBox() {
416                        if (right < 0)
417                                return null;
418                        else
419                                return new Rectangle(left, top, right-left + 1, bottom - top + 1);
420                }
421        
422                
423                /**
424                 * Returns the center of this region as a 2D point.
425                 * 
426                 * @return the center point of this region.
427                 */
428                public Pnt2d getCenter() {
429                        if (size == 0) {
430                                throw new IllegalStateException("empty region, center is undefined");
431                        }
432                        return PntDouble.from((double) x1Sum / size, (double) y1Sum / size);
433                }
434                
435                /**
436                 * Returns the centroid of this region as a 2D point.
437                 * Obsolete, use {@link #getCenter()} instead.
438                 * 
439                 * @return the centroid of this region.
440                 * @deprecated
441                 */
442                public Pnt2d getCentroid() {
443                        return this.getCenter();
444                }
445                
446                @Override
447                public Iterator<Pnt2d> iterator() {
448                        return new RegionPixelIterator(this);
449                }
450                
451                /**
452                 * Adds a single pixel to this region and updates summation
453                 * and boundary variables used to calculate various region statistics.
454                 * 
455                 * @param u x-position
456                 * @param v y-position
457                 */
458                protected void addPixel(int u, int v) {
459                        size = size + 1;
460                        x1Sum = x1Sum + u;
461                        y1Sum = y1Sum + v;
462                        x2Sum = x2Sum + u * u;
463                        y2Sum = y2Sum + v * v;
464                        xySum = xySum + u * v;
465                        if (u < left)   left = u;
466                        if (v < top)    top = v;
467                        if (u > right)  right = u;
468                        if (v > bottom) bottom = v;
469                }
470                
471                /**
472                 * Updates the region's statistics. 
473                 * Does nothing but may be overridden by inheriting classes.
474                 */
475                protected void update() {
476                }
477                
478                /**
479                 * Get the (single) outer contour of this region.
480                 * Points on an outer contour are arranged in clockwise
481                 * order.
482                 * @return the outer contour.
483                 */
484                public Contour.Outer getOuterContour() {
485                        return outerContour;
486                }
487                
488                protected void setOuterContour(Contour.Outer contr) {
489                        outerContour = contr;
490                }
491                
492                /**
493                 * Get all inner contours of this region.
494                 * Points on inner contours are arranged in counter-clockwise order.
495                 * @return the list of inner contours.
496                 */
497                public List<Contour.Inner> getInnerContours() { // sort!!!
498                        return innerContours;
499                }
500                
501                protected void addInnerContour(Contour.Inner contr) {
502                        if (innerContours == null) {
503                                innerContours = new LinkedList<>();
504                        }
505                        innerContours.add(contr);
506                }
507                
508                public String toString() {
509                        Formatter fm = new Formatter(new StringBuilder(), Locale.US);
510                        fm.format("Region %d", label);
511                        fm.format(", area = %d", size);
512                        fm.format(", bounding box = (%d, %d, %d, %d)", left, top, right, bottom );
513                        fm.format(", centroid = (%.2f, %.2f)", xc, yc);
514                        if (innerContours != null)
515                                fm.format(", holes = %d", innerContours.size());
516                        String s = fm.toString();
517                        fm.close();
518                        return s;
519                }
520                
521                // Compare method for sorting by region size (larger regions at front)
522                @Override
523                public int compareTo(BinaryRegion r2) {
524                        return r2.size - this.size;
525                }
526                
527                /**
528                 * Checks if the given pixel position is contained in this
529                 * {@link BinaryRegion} instance.
530                 * @param u x-coordinate
531                 * @param v y-coordinate
532                 * @return true if (u,v) is contained in this region
533                 */
534                public boolean contains(int u, int v) {
535                        return BinaryRegionSegmentation.this.getLabel(u, v) == this.label;
536                }
537                
538                // ------------------------------------------------------------
539                // ------------------------------------------------------------
540                
541                
542                /* EXPERIMENTAL STUFF for attaching region properties dynamically:
543                 * Properties can be used to hash results of region calculations
544                 * to avoid multiple calculations.
545                 * Currently, only 'double' values are supported.
546                 * 
547                 * E.g. calculate major axis angle theta for region r, then do
548                 *    r.setProperty("angle", theta);
549                 * and subsequently
550                 *    double theta = r.getProperty("angle");
551                 */
552                
553                private Map<Object, Double> properties = null;
554                
555                /**
556                 * Sets the specified property of this region to the given value.
557                 * @param key The key of the property.
558                 * @param val The value associated with this property.
559                 */
560                public void setProperty(Object key, double val) {
561                        if (properties == null) {
562                                properties = new HashMap<>();
563                        }
564                        properties.put(key, val);
565                }
566                
567                /**
568                 * Retrieves the specified region property. 
569                 * {@link IllegalArgumentException} is thrown if the property 
570                 * is not defined for this region.
571                 * 
572                 * @param key The key of the property.
573                 * @return The value associated with the specified property.
574                 */
575                public double getProperty(Object key) {
576                        Double value;
577                        if (properties == null || (value = properties.get(key)) == null) {
578                                throw new IllegalArgumentException("Region property " + key + " is undefined.");
579                        }
580                        return value.doubleValue();
581                }
582                
583                /**
584                 * Removes all properties attached to this region.
585                 */
586                public void clearProperties() {
587                        properties.clear();
588                }
589
590        } // end of class BinaryRegion
591        
592        // --------- Iteration over region pixels -----------------------------------
593        
594        /**
595         * Instances of this class are returned by {@link BinaryRegion#iterator()},
596         * which implements  {@link Iterable} for instances of class {@link Pnt2d}.
597         */
598        private class RegionPixelIterator implements Iterator<Pnt2d> {
599                private final int label;                                        // the corresponding region's label
600                private final int uMin, uMax, vMin, vMax;       // coordinates of region's bounding box
601                int uCur, vCur;                                                         // current pixel position
602                private Pnt2d pNext;                                            // coordinates of the next region pixel
603                private boolean first;                                          // control flag
604
605                RegionPixelIterator(BinaryRegion R) {
606                        label = R.getLabel();
607                        first = true;
608                        Rectangle bb = R.getBoundingBox();
609                        uMin = bb.x;
610                        uMax = bb.x + bb.width;
611                        vMin = bb.y;
612                        vMax = bb.y + bb.height;
613                        uCur = uMin;
614                        vCur = vMin;
615                        pNext = null;
616                }
617
618                /** 
619                 * Search from position (uCur, vCur) for the next valid region pixel.
620                 * Return the next position as a Point or null if no such point can be found.
621                 * Don't assume that (uCur, vCur) is a valid region pixel!
622                 * 
623                 * @return the next point
624                 */
625                private Pnt2d.PntInt findNext() {
626                        // start search for next region pixel at (u,v):
627                        int u = (first) ? uCur : uCur + 1;
628                        int v = vCur;
629                        first = false;
630                        while (v <= vMax) {
631                                while (u <= uMax) {
632                                        if (getLabel(u, v) == label) { // next pixel found (uses surrounding labeling)
633                                                uCur = u;
634                                                vCur = v;
635                                                return PntInt.from(uCur, vCur);
636                                        }
637                                        u++;
638                                }
639                                v++;
640                                u = uMin;
641                        }
642                        uCur = uMax + 1;        // just to make sure we'll never enter the loop again
643                        vCur = vMax + 1;
644                        return null;            // no next pixel found
645                }
646
647                @Override
648                public boolean hasNext() {
649                        if (pNext != null) {    // next element has been queried before but not consumed
650                                return true;
651                        }
652                        else {
653                                pNext = findNext();     // keep next pixel coordinates in pNext
654                                return (pNext != null);
655                        }
656                }
657
658                // Returns: the next element in the iteration
659                // Throws: NoSuchElementException - if the iteration has no more elements.
660                @Override
661                public Pnt2d next() {
662                        if (pNext != null || hasNext()) {
663                                Pnt2d pn = pNext;
664                                pNext = null;           // "consume" pNext
665                                return pn;
666                        }
667                        else {
668                                throw new NoSuchElementException();
669                        }
670                }
671
672                @Override
673                public void remove() {
674                        throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
675                }
676
677        } // end of class RegionPixelIterator
678
679}
